document.title: Quick Glance Checklist: 2020 NC ELD Standard Course of Study

14887E91100D461BB95B6FFEAAA1D38D.description: Show relationships between claims with reasons and multiple sources of evidence

3E85C1060CBC4C5EB1F13370E698CC11.description: Select relevant information to support claims with evidence from multiple sources

CB0884EE6F5B4DED81D70276A9C0C690.description: Argue.Expressive: Construct social studies arguments that:

6704D6BC2742470EA7BEFE024DE7C1E9.description: Evaluating point of view and credibility of source, based on distinctions between fact and opinion

587AFA9D007249C2BAE34FFE94AE489B.description: Analyzing relevant information from multiple sources to develop claims in response to compelling questions

604AE7F0248A4D978AA4EB2789F4D658.description: Identifying topic and purpose (argue in favor or against a position, present a balanced interpretation, challenge perspective)

7128312990134693BA025CF3DA9E7BB8.description: Argue.Interpretive: Interpret social studies arguments by:

964912A6E63545789823E91AB640A1CA.description: Generalize probable causes and effects of developments or events

0EDD51F5AF9849C4BCD70B26FE8D38FB.description: Describe components, order, causes and effects, or cycles using relevant examples and details

1B0AEAFD75BE4C40830A35F19CE8EAF6.description: Explain.Expressive: Construct social studies explanations that:

1D246003914549BDA98B12EE4028D5F0.description: Evaluating disciplinary concepts and ideas that are open to different interpretations

2B0D3441C5704B43A129E44F8CBA2A2D.description: Analyzing sources for a series of contributing factors or causes

CE41D279B8D649F0A932F1C2DCCF5056.description: Determining different opinions in sources for answering compelling and supporting questions about phenomena or events

5D0750E51947459BA00146D70BE2D911.description: Explain.Interpretive Interpret social studies explanations by:

9802F86A297E4ABCB610EC5C11371D94.description: Signal logical relationships among reasoning, relevant evidence, data, and/or a model when making a claim

A5DBA0DB570A400AB3D8A8F77ECD94F8.description: Establish a neutral tone or an objective stance

3C5CBC492DD644839A664A3158D72376.description: Make and define a claim based on evidence, data, and/or model

169A13083FE94C5098886F6C07591573.description: Introduce topic/phenomenon in issues related to the natural and designed world(s)

C99513967A39405BB924BBD0FC2C08F1.description: Distinguishing among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in an explanation

6E7BCF6DBADB426390713AE9D4FDFCB7.description: Comparing reasoning and claims based on evidence

AF10B290B82F434F8A20017D2FCEA79D.description: Identifying relevant evidence from data, models, and/or information from investigations of phenomena or design solutions

1FF9D1CCF522495BA7273A6504C104A4.description: Summarize and/or compare multiple solutions to a problem based on how well they meet the criteria and constraints of the design solution

2A795173C7904FE6A287F1193A6BCCCD.description: Develop reasoning to show relationships between evidence and claims

069A8E251EDC4904A417E0E8716AF286.description: Establish neutral or objective stance in communicating results

0D9A1B3B02F64F4C937730F5FBD19545.description: Describe observations and/or data about a phenomenon

7AD88DFFF4C74423901FFDED9501D25E.description: Identifying evidence that supports particular points in an explanation

B54B02F0B7D44F87864984E549F6EE7F.description: Obtaining and combining evidence and information to help explain how or why a phenomenon occurs

AF8FF5A45C3843978267B8844B460BC6.description: Defining investigable questions or design problems based on observations, data, and prior knowledge about a phenomenon

4E0D7EFCD9D943F2BFFCF01A95BF8D08.description: Justify conclusions with patterns or rules

2FD9A18557D845B0A18F3283F2BEB7C6.description: Generalize commonalities and differences across cases

0DF6C58F7358433E8A037973D2780EE8.description: Create conjecture using definitions, patterns, and rules

BD8095DBB22743379919CA112103B808.description: Extracting patterns or rules from solution strategies to create generalizations

ACDCC845575545C7BD59323783456318.description: Distinguishing commonalities and differences among ideas in justifications

56402119FA2A4943B5DEC720E6836E9C.description: Comparing conjectures with patterns, and/or rules

15E595252A0844708E751F11FF118939.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

8069D3F2AC87418D869ABCFC3B3970D8.description: Describe data and/or steps to solve problem

B03F5D3A12454DABBC1068EDB27D8956.description: Evaluating a pattern or structure that follows a given rule

2019CE6C1395428F9BD87ADB2BBDFDAD.description: Logically connect opinions to appropriate evidence, facts, and details; offer a concluding statement or section

7F08F6D35FE64D0CA6BA7FDD1050BCFD.description: Support opinions with reasons and information

55E76376FF174A77A485C514DE48F000.description: Introduce and develop a topic clearly; state an opinion

53335AADA8A84FAC921E89E236EF58A5.description: Argue.Expressive: Construct language arts arguments that:

2F26EA7DCD574A269A2D5AEA80F93932.description: Evaluating how details, reasons, and evidence support particular points in a text

CFB968F748AD4132999DF2A47AB4C0BB.description: Analyzing points of view about the same event or topic

F4264B74ADD0408EB39EA4AF12036909.description: Argue.Interpretive: Interpret language arts arguments by:

1AC3B40E9D4A461B86F7F9A4C37AB015.description: Develop coherence and cohesion throughout text

4A14867A3B9642EBBEBA398E8140BD99.description: Add precision and details to define, describe, compare, and classify topic and/or entity

CC21FC3812194325AFCD0A01FF1AA146.description: Introduce and define topic and/or entity for audience

6C26553D3F6C4743A5D048AF43F7E868.description:
Inform.Expressive: Construct informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) that:

6CAE4B550C484317A41774CEF5E3A1C3.description: Evaluating the impact of key word choices in a text

2C59AF1324D9455889E170AC10E0ACC4.description: Analyzing details and examples for key attributes, qualities, and characteristics

F46F6CD69E9D4F0CB3A4532C66C64DD8.description: Identifying and summarizing main ideas and key details

D91486CE10A0408CA06FB12330DBB6E2.description:
Inform.Interpretive: Interpret informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) by:

487A6E80F6AF448B964F8B9A717C31C2.description: Develop story with complication and resolution, time and event sequences

4ABB7209ED3148B497A21E4DD1BD8B6A.description: Develop and describe characters and their relationships

D3995826FF2040A29A39D296DC690D02.description:
Narrate.Expressive: Construct language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
that:

4366D8820FF344B081B39242B6FD3597.description: Determining the meaning of words and phrases used in texts, including figurative language, such as metaphors and similes

2144CA06381E4F9A98E6E3FE04230B80.description: Analyzing how character attributes and actions develop across event sequences

D21D2EBB911945B78CB85215DF1B85E4.description:
Narrate.Interpretive: Interpret language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
by:

2214D5C1C67F4AB99054F1E8A94ABAED.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

3C6C06B1B2A24C0880F42315AEF773F5.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

92285EF763564BB9AA0C05DB77C10E0D.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

773E75B7A66949938D27DD6D197CB3D7.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

381EB027974E4732A4177164E0C7EEF2.description: Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular ways

87D9AE8BE33B4D1B9B40AD8918482790.description: Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular outcomes

B706BFBBB6E44591B79A98E35CE375B8.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

353BAB5FABBD4D748F96E2CE994BB67C.description: Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and effects

060004D9E9AD44BFA12B54D2DB86B488.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

EA2A3B7947D94AB08B075969BBCC121F.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

D3E73C0B14144D9BBC83440AC310C2DD.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

A4999625CF8445E6B0A6030A79AEF9CA.description: Define and classify facts and interpretations; determine what is known vs. unknown

A43240B91F9F4EBC8030A16AC7D6EA3A.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

1D9FB17CA8024003B1F04F33F4469BB5.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

2A49CF5DFDE5401D80248D64FBB91DFE.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

74B92990F38544A396F0A905734AD565.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

33F42A2698304409B9B2BEF7919747A2.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
